Australia tour of Pakistan: 'Some guys weren't ready to be here,' Aussie captain reveals
description: Australia captain Mitchell Marsh believes the short turnaround from the BBL final won't hinder his team's readiness for the T20I series against Pakistan. He emphasized that preparation varies for players, with many already focused on the upcoming tri-series and the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: ‘I’m ready for reunion': OPS says he is open for AIADMK reunification; EPS rejects re-entry
description: Expelled AIADMK leader O Panneerselvam expressed readiness for factional reunification, challenging TTV Dhinakaran and Edappadi Palaniswami to do the same. He dismissed speculation about joining other parties or contesting under a new banner, emphasizing his focus on restoring cadre rights and testing support in the Lok Sabha polls.

title: ‘Money is replaceable, love isn’t’: The emotional journey of a pet dog from Hyderabad to Australia
'Just spoke to Virat': Ashwin breaks silence on 'indirect attack' accusation
description: Ravichandran Ashwin and Virat Kohli, long-time teammates, shared a remarkable Test journey, achieving significant milestones together. Despite past reports of differing views on selection, their bond remains strong, as evidenced by a recent interaction where they laughed off fan-driven online rivalries. This highlights the enduring camaraderie between cricketing legends amidst fan-fueled debates.

title: SC, ST, OBC employees make up 66% of sanitation workers, 40% of Group A staff: DoPT report flags representation gaps
'We spent every penny we had': Indian couple spend Rs 15 lakh to reunite with their pet
description: A Hyderabad couple, Divya and John, moved to Australia for work but were heartbroken to leave their golden retriever, Sky, behind. Facing stringent Australian pet import laws and a hefty ₹15 lakh cost, they saved diligently and sent Sky to a quarantine facility in Dubai.

title: Linkin Park dons khadi clothes from Kamal Haasan’s brand during Mumbai concert; actor thanks band for ‘linking khadi to the world’

Union Budget 2026: Experts warn funding alone won’t future-proof universities
description: India's upcoming Union Budget 2026 is prepared to prioritize the education sector. With global economic shifts and rising international education costs, policymakers are focusing on strengthening domestic capacity. Increased funding, tax support, and skill development are crucial. This will help expand India's education system, adapt to economic changes, and prepare students for future opportunities.

title: ‘Hey chha-chhu kaam ahe’: When Ajit Pawar slammed contractor, cops for slipshod work at Pune police HQ
Insta post, injection, viral video: Sadhvi Prem Baisa 'suspicious death' triggers protest
description: A 25-year-old religious preacher, Sadhvi Prem Baisa, died after collapsing during fever treatment at her ashram, sparking protests from devotees demanding a thorough investigation. Hours after her death, an Instagram post, described as a suicide note, appeared, referencing a denied 'trial by fire' and seeking justice.

Read Amazon’s email to 16,000 laid-off staff after company-wide review
description: Amazon has initiated a new wave of corporate layoffs, impacting approximately 16,000 roles across the US, UK, and India. Senior Vice President Beth Galetti informed affected employees via email about the difficult decision, citing a thorough organizational review. The company is providing support measures including severance, 90 days of full pay and benefits, and job placement assistance.

Rani Kapur Trust Challenge: Delhi HC judge recuses from plea; matter moves to new bench
description: Sunjay Kapur's mother, Rani Kapur, has approached the Delhi High Court challenging the validity of a family trust established in her name. She alleges the trust was fraudulently set up to divert her assets, with provisions benefiting her late son and his wife, Priya Kapur, over her.

Nipah virus can remain dormant for up to 45 days: Doctors reveal why this is dangerous
description: Nipah virus, a deadly zoonotic disease with a 40-75% fatality rate, is causing concern after cases in West Bengal. Spreading from fruit bats to humans via contaminated food or direct contact, it presents with flu-like symptoms before progressing to severe neurological issues like encephalitis and seizures. Currently, no specific treatment or vaccine exists, making early detection and isolation crucial.

title: ‘Teach them early’: Viral video of kids playing with reading lights in train triggers civic sense outrage

OpenAI 'troubles' hit Microsoft, pull down company's shares as investors worry ...
description: Microsoft's stock saw a significant drop after its earnings report. Investors focused on worries about its cloud service, Azure. Growth in Azure is reportedly slowing. Microsoft's increasing dependence on OpenAI, the maker of ChatGPT, is also a concern. This dependency accounts for a large portion of future cloud commitments. The company is facing capacity issues for its cloud services.

Economic survey 2026: Railway infrastructure growth continues, electrification touches 99.1% by October 2025
‘Vague, capable of misuse’: SC stays new UGC rules amid uproar — key quotes
description: A bench of Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justice Joymalya Bagchi issued notices to the Centre and the UGC on the pleas challenging the regulation. The new UGC regulations, notified on January 23, were challenged by various petitioners as being arbitrary, exclusionary, discriminatory and in violation of the Constitution as well as the University Grants Commission Act, 1956.

title: Relationship tip of the day: Ruskin Bond's witty reality check about marriages
description: Renowned storyteller Ruskin Bond beautifully illustrates love's evolution, contrasting the passionate "red roses" of early romance with the nourishing "French beans" of long-term relationships.  He emphasizes that enduring love isn't just about grand gestures but the quiet, everyday commitment and shared sustenance, a profound truth for lasting partnerships.

title: ‘Why wait?’: Ex-India keeper-batter wants Ishan Kishan in, Sanju Samson out
description: Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel advocates for Ishan Kishan to replace Sanju Samson in the fifth and final T20I against New Zealand. Patel believes Kishan, who has impressed on his return, should be given the wicketkeeper-batter role immediately if he is the team's preferred choice for the T20 World Cup.

title: Pakistan vs Australia 1st T20 Live Cricket Score: Matthew Short departs for 5, AUS 21/1 (Target 169) vs PAK in Lahore
Kerala Budget session: Rs 14,500 crore welfare boost—key points
description: Kerala's finance minister presented a people-focused budget for 2026-27, allocating Rs 14,500 crore for social security and community programs. Key announcements include the formation of the 12th Pay Revision Commission and the Assured Pension Scheme, replacing NPS for eligible employees. The budget also boosts honorariums for ASHA and Anganwadi workers, and allocates funds for infrastructure projects like the RRTS.

Economic Survey 2026: Will India-US trade deal be sealed this year?
description: India's trade talks with the US are nearing completion this year, potentially easing external uncertainties, according to the Economic Survey 2026.  While progress has been slow, concluding these negotiations could boost investor sentiment.  The survey also emphasizes India's need to enhance manufacturing competitiveness to fully leverage trade agreements amidst global economic headwinds.

title: How rupee became a victim of geopolitics & a strategic power gap in 2025: Economic Survey explains

description: Sunny Deol's patriotic fervor continues to dominate the box office. 'Border 2' has achieved a massive opening, raking in ₹213 crore in its first week, fueled by strong Republic Day sentiment. While not matching 'Gadar 2's' record-breaking pace, the film's success highlights Deol's enduring appeal, especially in mass centers and single screens.

description: Recent video footage has surfaced showing Alex Pretti engaged in a heated exchange with immigration officers shortly before his tragic shooting by Border Patrol. The clip captures Pretti approaching federal vehicles, culminating in an altercation that involved the use of tear gas.

Ajit Pawar plane crash: Black box recovered; govt assures time-bound probe
description: The ministry of civil aviation is conducting a swift and transparent investigation into the Learjet 45 aircraft crash that tragically claimed the lives of Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others. Teams from the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau and Directorate General of Civil Aviation have reached the crash site, and crucial black box data recorders have been recovered.

title: Vihaan joins RCB, fulfills childhood dream: Young star set to play with Kohli
description: Nine-year-old Vihaan Malhotra's dream to play with Virat Kohli has materialised as he was bought by Royal Challengers Bengaluru for Rs 30 lakh in the IPL 2026 auction. The 19-year-old, India's only centurion in the ongoing U-19 World Cup, has transformed into an all-dimensional player, impressing with his batting, bowling, and fielding.

description: A six-year-old boy drowned at a Delhi swimming pool on June 13, 2025, due to alleged negligence and lack of basic safety measures. Six months later, his grieving family seeks justice, having moved the Delhi High Court after police filed a case against the pool owner and manager.

25 cases of hate speech still pending: Akal Takht on police action against Delhi youth

Pune: 3 teens lure friend via fake profile of girl, murder him and dump body in river
description: Three 15-year-old boys were detained in Pune for allegedly murdering a peer over a friendship with a girl. The victim was lured to a secluded spot using a fake social media profile and subsequently bludgeoned to death before his body was dumped into the Mula river on Republic Day.

title: Court slams MP for withholding ‘dying declaration’ of woman
Girl misses exam due to delay, railways to pay Rs 9L
description: A young woman has been awarded Rs 9.1 lakh in compensation after a delayed train prevented her from attending a crucial entrance exam in 2018. The district consumer commission found the railways accountable for the two-and-a-half-hour delay, which caused her to miss her BSc biotechnology exam at Lucknow University.

title: Baramati plane crash: Wristwatch, sitting position help cops identify Ajit Pawar’s body
description: Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's body was identified after a Learjet 45 aircraft crashed near Baramati. Police used his wristwatch and familiar seating position to confirm his identity. The aircraft departed Mumbai and was on final approach to Baramati when the incident occurred. Pilots reported runway visibility issues before the crash.

title: ‘Vijay is not afraid’: SA Chandrasekhar breaks silence on Jana Nayagan release delay
description: As Jana Nayagan continues to face uncertainty over its theatrical release, filmmaker SA Chandrasekhar, father of Thalapathy Vijay, addressed the repeated delays while speaking to the media earlier in the day. Reacting to the latest legal developments, Chandrasekhar made it clear that Vijay remains undeterred and ready to face every challenge ahead.

title: Delhi horror: 6-year-old girl sexually assaulted; 2 boys held, one absconding
description: A six-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by three boys, aged nine to sixteen, in northeast Delhi's Bhajanpura. Two boys were apprehended, while the eldest reportedly fled to Bihar. The survivor's family protested the incident, which occurred on January 18th, with the girl returning home injured.
